page.title: 02SOUTHILL LOWER SCHOOL
page.content: Southill Lower School is situated in the village of{SOUTHILL}and takes children of the ages 5 to 9.In nineteen eighty five on a typical Monday morning,the children copied words from a blackboard by writing with pencils on paper.After doing this they would watch a television programme entitled 'Picture Box.'This was a programme about certain aspects of a child's life.Most of the children enjoyed working at the school.The youngest children seemed to be more enthusiastic than the older children. The average pocket money for a child aged seven in nineteen eighty five was three to five pounds a month.The school had one computer to share between all the children.A typical school meal consisted of chips,beans and sausages and chocolate sponge with sauce for pudding.
